page.title: 04THE AMBULANCE STATION
page.content: The ambulance station is situated on the main A38 road,just north of the M5 motorway. The station serves the main {hospitals}of the area, Frenchay, Southmead, Bristol Royal Infirmary and Ham Green. There are three types of{ambulance used, the main one being the Bedford type which has{plenty of room}at the back for first aid equipment.The second type is the Range Rover, much faster and more powerful.This is used to deal with{farming accidents,}where patients may be trapped in muddy fields,it is also used for {transporting people}long distances to their home.The third type is the mini bus type or 'Boss' which takes {outpatients}to hospital for checkups. The{equipment}found in the main ambulance consists of:oxygen,first aid resuscitation gear and 2 stretchers.
